page.title: 03CLATWORTHY RESERVOIR
page.content: CLATWORTHY RESERVOIR The reservoir lies to the north-west of the village of Clatworthy.It can hold up to 50 million gallons of water.There is a nature trail to the east of the reservoir which attracts a large number of visitors to the reservoir during the summer months. There is also a viewpoint to the south of the nature trail. An Iron Age hill fort lies to the north-east of the reservoir. On June 7 1985, a group of second-year pupils from Bishop Fox's School, Taunton visited the reservoir. One of the pupils, Gail Wilson, of form 2Ssk filled in the following questionnaire about the reservoir :
